creditline: The Siri and Bob Marshall Endowment for American Paintings
description: broad view of Mississippi River with two figures in rowboat to L of center; small sailboat to the L; mill buildings with river boats and passengers on shore at R; faint river bluffs in distance; upper 2/3 is sky with a rainstorm at L and blue sky at R; ornate gold frame
markings: brass plate at BC of frame: ALFRED T. BRICHER / (1837 * 1908) / MISSISSIPPI AT DUBUQUE, IOWA
text: This scene of the Mississippi River, depicted from the vantage point of being on the river, shows people sailing, rowing and waiting to board more modern vessels. The crisp, carefully-observed quality of light captures the stark contrasts that occur as the sun re-emerges after a storm. The water is like a mirror and the whites of sails and painted ships appear to shine against the moody atmosphere lingering as the storm passes.
title: Mississippi at Dubuque, Iowa
